Enum.comment: FW capability IDs\nEach ID maps to a bit in a 32-bit bitmask value provided by the FW to\nthe host

Enum.comment:
WMI_START_SCAN_CMDID

Start L1 scan operation

Returned events:
- WMI_RX_MGMT_PACKET_EVENTID - for every probe resp.
- WMI_SCAN_COMPLETE_EVENTID

Member.comment: run scan with discovery beacon. Relevant for ACTIVE scan only.

Member.comment: Max duration in the home channel(ms)

WMI_SET_APPIE_CMDID
Add Application specified IE to a management frame

Struct.comment:
WMI_ECHO_CMDID
Check FW is alive
WMI_DEEP_ECHO_CMDID
Check FW and ucode are alive
Returned event: WMI_ECHO_RSP_EVENTID
same event for both commands

WMI_TEMP_SENSE_DONE_EVENTID

The names of the led as
described on HW schemes.

Combination of on and off
creates the blinking period

Struct.comment: \nRate search parameters configuration per connection\n
Struct.name: wmi_rs_cfg

cfg_type

Configure common Power Save parameters of the device and all MIDs.

- WMI_PS_DEV_CFG_EVENTID

WMI_PS_DEV_CFG_READ_CMDID

request to retrieve device Power Save configuration
(WMI_PS_DEV_CFG_CMD params)

Returned event:
- WMI_PS_DEV_CFG_READ_EVENTID

Struct.comment: \nPer Mac Power Save configurations\n
Struct.name: wmi_ps_mid_cfg

Member.name: beacon_lprx_enable
Member.comment: Low power RX in BTI is enabled, BOOL

Member.name: beacon_sync_to_sectorId_enable
Member.comment: Sync to sector ID enabled, BOOL

Member.name: frame_exchange_lprx_enable
Member.comment: Low power RX in DTI is enabled, BOOL

Member.name: scheduled_sleep_cycle_pow2
Member.comment: Sleep Cycle while in scheduled PS, 1-31

Member.name: scheduled_num_of_awake_bis
Member.comment: Stay Awake for k BIs every (sleep_cycle - k) BIs, 1-31

Member.name: num_of_failed_beacons_rx_to_trigger_web
Member.comment: Trigger WEB after k failed beacons

Member.name: num_of_failed_beacons_rx_to_trigger_bf
Member.comment: Trigger BF after k failed beacons

Member.name: num_of_successful_beacons_rx_to_trigger_sob
Member.comment: Trigger SOB after k successful beacons

Struct.comment:
WMI_PS_MID_CFG_CMDID

Configure Power Save parameters of a specific MID.
These parameters are relevant for the specific BSS this MID belongs to.

Returned event:
- WMI_PS_MID_CFG_EVENTID

Member.comment: mid PS configuration to be applied

WMI_PS_MID_CFG_READ_CMDID

- WMI_PS_MID_CFG_READ_EVENTID

max_num_of_dest

Enum.name: wmi_rf_sector_status
Enum.comment: Result status codes for WMI commands

Struct.name: wmi_rf_sector_info
Struct.comment: Content of RF Sector (six 32-bits registers)

Member.name: psh_hi
Member.comment: Phase values for RF Chains[15-0] (2bits per RF chain)

Member.name: psh_lo
Member.comment: Phase values for RF Chains[31-16] (2bits per RF chain)

Member.name: etype0
Member.comment: ETYPE Bit0 for all RF chains[31-0] - bit0 of Edge amplifier gain index

Member.name: etype1
Member.comment: ETYPE Bit1 for all RF chains[31-0] - bit1 of Edge amplifier gain index

Member.name: etype2
Member.comment: ETYPE Bit2 for all RF chains[31-0] - bit2 of Edge amplifier gain index

Member.name: dtype_swch_off
Member.comment: D-Type values (3bits each) for 8 Distribution amplifiers + X16 switch bits

Member.name: sector_type
Member.comment: enum wmi_rf_sector_type - type of requested RF sector

Member.name: rf_modules_vec
Member.comment: bitmask vector specifying destination RF modules

Member.name: reserved
Member.comment: align next field to U64 boundary

Member.name: tsf
Member.comment: TSF timestamp when RF sectors where retrieved

Member.name: sectors_info
Member.comment: Content of RF sector retrieved from each RF module

Member.name: sector_type
Member.comment: enum wmi_rf_sector_type - type of requested RF sector

Member.name: rf_modules_vec
Member.comment: bitmask vector specifying destination RF modules

Member.name: sectors_info
Member.comment: Content of RF sector to be written to each RF module

Struct.name: GET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX
Struct.comment: \nWMI_GET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX_CMD - Get RF sector index selected by TXSS/BRP for communication with specified CID\n

Member.name: sector_type
Member.comment: type of requested RF sector (enum wmi_rf_sector_type)

Struct.name: GET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX_DONE
Struct.comment: \WMI_GET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX_DONE_EVENT - Returns retrieved RF sector index selected by TXSS/BRP for communication with specified CID\n

Member.name: sector_idx
Member.comment: Retrieved sector index selected in TXSS (for TX sector request) or BRP (for RX sector request)

Member.name: reserved
Member.comment: align next field to U64 boundary

Member.name: tsf
Member.comment: TSF timestamp when result was retrieved

Struct.name: SET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX
Struct.comment: \nWMI_SET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX_CMD - Force RF sector index for communication with specified CID. Assumes that TXSS/BRP is disabled by other command\n

Member.name: sector_type
Member.comment: type of requested RF sector (enum wmi_rf_sector_type)

Struct.name: SET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX_DONE
Struct.comment: \WMI_SET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX_DONE_EVENT - Success/Fail status for WMI_SET_SELECTED_RF_SECTOR_INDEX_CMD\n

Member.name: rf_modules_vec
Member.comment: bitmask vector specifying destination RF modules

Struct.name: SET_RF_SECTOR_ON_DONE
